label: S8 Suppression from Bulk Viscosity
mathematical_goal: Explain S8 tension (Planck 0.832 vs weak lensing ~0.76) via bulk viscosity from G2 moduli
theoretical_significance: The S8 tension is a 2-3 sigma discrepancy between CMB (Planck S8 = 0.832) and weak lensing (KiDS/DES S8 ~ 0.76) measurements of structure growth. PM resolves this via bulk viscosity from G2 moduli, which suppresses structure growth at late times. The suppression factor ~0.91 brings the Planck value into agreement with lensing surveys.
derivation_chain: Viscosity: xi ~ c_kaf/(2*Pi^2) * Sqrt[z] ~ 0.92 at z=0.45
